title: The Government’s shameful failure to introduce online porn safeguards is a betrayal of our children
text:
It’s a month since the latest cohort of 11-year-old boys started secondary school. And what an education it will have been. Not in geography, chemistry or music – more biology (human) and history (search history, that is).

I say this with a heavy heart, but wherever two or more (or, indeed, fewer) were gathered together, they will have viewed pornography. On phones. On tablets. On laptops, in high definition.

Not just adventures in anatomy. Not prompted by age-appropriate curiosity about bodies and what to do with them (albeit many years’ hence). I’m talking about nasty, brutish, misogynstic porn. Violence and degradation that is far more the stuff of horror movies than the well-thumbed magazines...
description: It’s a month since the latest cohort of 11-year-old boys started secondary school.
